QuALITYSourceMaterial.title: Pied Piper of Mars
contents: Elath Taen made mad music for the men of Mars.
The red planet lived and would die to the
soul-tearing tunes of his fiendish piping.

setup.question: Why did Ranson feel safe returning to Haller's home?
answers: He knew Maxwell's patrol wouldn't search for him there.

Text.text: Ranson had killed Haller in self-defense, and to escape from Cap Maxwell's patrol, he went to Haller's home precisely because he knew Maxwell wouldn't look for him there, as seen here
The house is NOT deserted, Ranson returns and finds Dr. Elath Taen in the lab hidden in the house. Ev provided later

It is only after realizing that the house is deserted that Ranson enters it, meaning the only reason he goes in is because it is deserted.

There is no correlation between Ranson feeling safe bc the house was deserted, but Ranson specifically says he felt there was no danger because Maxwell wouldn't look for him there. If it was about the house being deserted, he could've picked any other deserted place on Mars to hide- it didn't have to be Haller's home. Ev proving the lab in the house wasn't deserted.

Ranson makes the judgement that the house is empty and thus he should go in earlier than the judgement that Maxwell wouldn't look for him. Proximity to decision should be weighed.
